name: best_of_2_seeds
hypothesis: CMA-ES can get stuck in suboptimal basins. Running 2 instances with different seeds may find better global optimum.

prior_evidence.more_inits_select_best: FAILED - MORE inits add overhead without benefit
prior_evidence.conclusion: Prior experiments used 3-5 inits. Testing if 2 is the sweet spot.

planned_configs.description: 2 seeds with standard budget (20/36 fevals total, split)
planned_configs.rationale: Test baseline hypothesis with half budget per seed

planned_configs.description: 2 seeds with slightly higher budget (24/40 fevals total)
planned_configs.rationale: If Run 1 is promising but over budget, try with slightly more evals

planned_configs.description: Baseline comparison: 1 seed with full budget
planned_configs.rationale: Direct comparison to understand if 2 seeds helps

conclusions.finding: Multi-seed approach is WORSE than single seed. Score -0.0306 below baseline, 2.2x over budget. Sample 7 had catastrophic RMSE=0.5374.
conclusions.root_cause: Budget splitting prevents CMA-ES covariance learning. Each instance needs full budget to adapt properly.
conclusions.recommendation: Do not pursue multi-seed strategies. Single-seed full-budget is optimal.
